label: Description
value: Near bottom edge, single wide band of green. Inside this band are squares containing motifs printed in gold. In the center is a large anthemia-like motif.  A band of floral finials above, with a band of pendents, swags and tassels below. Printed on deep brown ground.

label: Description
value: Wide central band of Anglo-Japanesque in gold, with flowers and wheat above, and swags with tassels below. Burgundy flock with metallic gold, silver and green on light green fabric support.

label: Physical description
value: Block printed and flocked on canvaa

label: Description
value: Two boys and two large dogs at watering trough. Surrounded by foliage. Printed in metallic colors and burgundy flock on light green fabric support. Flitter shade with applied gold mica flakes.

label: Physical description
value: Block printed and flocked, applied mica flakes, canvas

label: Description
value: Two different window shade bottoms or valances, each printed in colors on brown ground.

label: Description
value: Parts of four different metallic gold frameworks. Printed on brown ground with fabric support.

label: Description
value: Support is printed on both sides. On recto: three separate elements, each showing the bottom portion of a framework. Printed in metallic gold on a green support. On verso: four separate elements, each showing either the top or bottom portion of a framework. Printed in metallic colors on green support.

label: Description
value: Three design elements printed on a tan ground. Each of the three elements is a different example of a frame style. The outer two elements each contain an urn with a bouquet of flowers that is hand painted. THe frames printed in colors and metallic pigments.

label: Physical description
value: Block-printed and hand painted on canvas

label: Dimensions
value: Overall: 158 x 99 cm (5 ft. 2 3/16 in. x 39 in.)

label: Description
value: Wide band of scrolling foliage and floral motifs near bottom edge. Printed in gold, silver, copper and green mica with burgundy flock outlines. Printed on light green fabric support.

label: Physical description
value: Block-printed and flocked with mica flakes

label: Description
value: Wood printing block with floral bouquet in urn. Anglo-Japanesque in style.

label: Description
value: Creating a section of picture frame-like design, wide gold area overprinted in corners with acorns and oak leaves. White ornament in corners of interior. Printed on deep brown fabric support.

label: Description
value: Assortment of leaves and berries along with gothic motifs. Black outline on gold background on brown paper ground.

label: Physical description
value: Block printed and hand painted on paper

label: Description
value: Stylized floral bouquets alternating with daisy-like flower. Printed in metallic gold, bronze, deep red and black  on light green fabric support.

label: Description
value: Band of stylized floral motifs, with two motifs alternating, near bottom edge. Printed in black and gold with mica flake highlights, on mauve background. Band of ornament above and pendants below. Printed on gray fabric support.

label: Description
value: Printed in wide band near bottom edge: gray half-circles under beading, alternating with motif resembling cast-iron fence. Overprinted with stylized floral motifs. Bell flower pendants below. Printed in gray, metallic gold, black, pink and brown on an olive green fabric support.

label: Description
value: Two stylized plant motifs alternated, each having yellow branches with black leaves, across one end of shade. Each contains a large red circle ornament in the central area.  The plant motifs are printed against a gold background containing fan-like motifs. Printed on a green shade.

label: Description
value: Green band containing square gold motifs runs across one end of shade. Above this band are small stylized floral motifs. Below, is a fringed swag with tassels printed in flock. Printed on a pale green shade.
Plate, from Emblemata nobilitati et vulgo scitu digna (Emblems worth knowing noble and common men)

label: Description
value: Vertical rectangle showing a densely ornamented frame of scrolling plants, monkeys and fantastic animals. Blank cartouches at top and bottom. At center, a blank armorial shield cartouche with swags and a helmet.

label: Credit line
value: Museum purchase from General Acquisitions Endowment Fund

label: Description
value: Vertically symmetrical pattern of exotic flowers loosely held together by an ogee foremat. Yellow background.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: silk Technique: predominately warp-caced plain weave patterned by a continuous supplementary weft (white) and discontinuous supplementary wefts (multi-colors); supplementary wefts bound on the front in 1 3 twill

label: Dimensions
value: Warp x Weft: 96 x 48.5 cm (37 13/16 x 19 1/8 in.)

label: Credit line
value: Museum purchase from General Acquisitions Endowment Fund

label: Description
value: Heavy symmetrical leafy ogee-type grid framing blossoms in 6-lobed medallions in white on a yellow background. The medallion in the center of the fabric holds a phoenix rising from a pyre bearing a scroll "NORS VIVE" in mirror imaged letters. Pattern embellished with red, green, and blue details in uncut pile loops. The white was cut-pile velvet, now mostly worn off; the yellow 1/2 twill.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: silk Technique: supplementary warp pile (velvet), voided, with 1/2 twill

label: Credit line
value: Museum purchase from General Acquisitions Endowment Fund

label: Notes
value: Heavy symmetrical leafy ogee-type grid framing blossoms in 6-lobed medallions in white on a yellow background. The medallion in the center of the fabric holds a phoenix rising from a pyre bearing a scroll "NORS VIVE" in mirror imaged letters. Pattern embellished with red, green, and blue details in uncut pile loops. The white was cut-pile velvet, now mostly worn off; the yellow 1/2 twill.

label: Description
value: Warp stripes of various widths in green, yellow, salmon, pale pink, and white; some with small checks in a contrasting color using blue, yellow and orange supplementary warps.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: silk Technique: predominantly warp-faced plain weave with supplementary warp patterning

label: Dimensions
value: Warp x Weft (weft selvedge to selvedge): 100 x 57.2 cm (39 3/8 x 22 1/2 in.)

label: Credit line
value: Museum purchase from General Acquisitions Endowment Fund

label: Description
value: Length of green damask with rows of a zigzag pattern with a leaf or flower at the apex of each change in angle.  Red, white and yellow warp strip at each side.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: silk Technique: 4&1 satin damask; warp float face of the satin for background

label: Dimensions
value: Warp x Weft: 59 x 59 cm (23 1/4 x 23 1/4 in.)

label: Credit line
value: Museum purchase from General Acquisitions Endowment Fund

label: Description
value: Light tortoiseshell lorgnette with handle slightely widened toward bottom; gold monogram, conjoined "BS," at bottom of handle.

label: Physical description
value: Formed tortoiseshell, applied gold, glass, metal

label: Description
value:
A large house with trees, flowers, birds, butterflies and a verse:
This work in hand my friends may have 
When I am dead and in my grave 
And when my work each time you see 
With fond remembrance think on me

and the inscription:
Ellen Caufield (?) worked in the 12th year of her age 1831 
C.M.T. teacher  
Wheeling, Virginia 

With a  flowering vine border on three sides.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: silk embroidery on linen foundation Technique: embroidered in satin, cross and rococo stitches on plain weave foundation

label: Description
value: Vase in form of flattened oval, with truncated top forming oval lip.  Flat base.  Decorated with mottled brown and white underglaze slip at back.  At front, pale blue ground decorated in trailed and brushed slip with winter landscape;  foreground mottled white and brown, with double row of leafless trees.  Interior clear glazed over tan body.  fine crackle over entire surface.

label: Credit line
value: Gift of Dona Guimaraes in memory of Sarah McGuffey

label: Description
value: Straight-sided cylindrical vase with flat foot and lip.  Around base a 1 1/8 inch band of incised trilobe leaves, outlined in blue.  Around vase, incised line spiraling upward to lip, upon which are seated nine stylized children in  various postures, each with hair standing on end.  All figures with incised outlines filled with cobalt blue.  Vase glazed overall (interior and exterior) in grey-green color with fine crackle.

label: Dimensions
value: H x diam.: 19 x 8.3 cm (7 1/2 x 3 1/4 in.)

label: Credit line
value: Gift of Dona Guimaraes in memory of Sarah McGuffey

Simple directions in needlework and cutting out; intended for the use of the National Female Schools of Ireland. To which are added specimens of work executed by the pupils of the National Model Female School

label: Description
value: 84 pages of text, followed by specimens of plain sewing.

label: Credit line
value: Gift of The Cleveland Museum of Art

label: Description
value: Iron bench for three people painted white. Heart-shaped pattern on apron. Scrolling and crowned backrest.

label: Dimensions
value: Overall: 2.6 x 2.3 x 2.2 cm (1 x 7/8 x 7/8 in.)

label: Credit line
value: Gift from the Thomas W. Evans Collection from University of Pennsylvania School of Dental Medicine
Imperial Presentation Box with Napoleon III's Cipher

label: Description
value: A gold box with a personalized lid. The letter "N" in each of the lid's corners in diamonds. The center of the lid is decorated with another larger letter "N" in diamonds with a diamond crown above the letter. Along the sides of the box there is an abstract design carved in gold.

label: Provenance
value: Thomas W. Evans Collection from University of Pennsylvania School of Dental Medicine; 1983: acquired by the Museum

label: Credit line
value: Gift from the Thomas W. Evans Collection from University of Pennsylvania School of Dental Medicine

label: Description
value: Box and cover with diamond decoration in corners and cartouche framing the central abstract design.  Gold foliate motifs along the periphery of the cover as well as on the sides of the box.  Classical motif on each corner of the box and center of the front separated by rectangular forms encasing small circular pattern.

label: Provenance
value: Thomas W. Evans, University of Pennsylvania School of Dental Medicine; 1983: acquired by Museum

label: Credit line
value: Gift from the Thomas W. Evans Collection from University of Pennsylvania School of Dental Medicine
